Laser Beam


Laser Beam is a data visualization project showing third party trackers on popular websites.

The project's purpose is to help users understand the array of first and third party companies people interact with every day across the Web. It also educates users about the third-party trackers active on the websites they are browsing, in a perspective of data privacy. It is inspired from the open source project "Light Beam" created by Mozilla in 2013.

The center nodes reprsent the first party websites and the surronding nodes reprsent the third party trackers. The network graph is interactive: users can drag and drop within the contained box; while hovering on the center node, the third-party tracker names will appear; while clicking on the center node, the website and its trackers will light up - just like a laser beam!

Try the filter to select or deselect any companies - the graph will update instantly! The Bar-chart is also interactive! Try it out!
